Comments_List: I learned the foundations and theory behind basic statistical methods, whereas my other biostatistics classes were more of using computer output to answer questions but not knowing exactly how these  statistics came about.
Critical thinking and statistical knowledge.
How to use different tests, find estimates, use minitab, etc.

I learned important stuff about estimation, hypothesis testing and linear model. It helps me to think about and evaluate the statistics questions in a more complete way, for example based on different criterions we may prefer different statistics.
Theory of statsitics

Great introduction to statistics, the main tools and vocabulary, results about parameter estimation, goodness of fit, hypothesis testing, linear regression, comparison of two or more samples. Even some practice on R at the end of the course.
Statistical Theories
I gained some understanding of the mathematical theory behind basic statistical concepts.
I gain a nice exposure to probability distributions, different methods of estimating the true parameter, hypothesis testing, and least square regression.
Many statistical analysis skills such as MLE, MGF and regression.
Statistical knowledge and basic calculations

a good understanding of the statistics fundamental knowledge such as the concept of least square estimate and maximum likelihood estimate. learnt how to conduct hypothesis tests, including ANOVA, likelihood ratio test, regression model building.
Statistics concepts
thanks
Theory of stat.
I learned about the theory of statistics, and developed stronger analytical skills

The course was very organized, and I enjoyed that it was taught with the blackboard rather than powerpoints so that it is a lot more engaging. The homework was also very applicable to course material, which enriched the learning experience.
I think it can be improved by making the midterm harder and giving less guidance as to what will be on the midterm.
I think the material are very useful. But I do hope the lecture could be more clearly structured. Sometimes the notes are not very clear and organized.

I wish Professor Barron could write more than talk. The course itself is informative, and sometimes it is hard to make notes when the professor is only speaking but not writing the ideas on the backboard.
I also hope the TAs are able to hold the discussion session at some more reasonable times instead of late in the evening.
It covered a lot of stuff and all of them are really helpful. But it would be better if professor can give a conclusion remarks about what we learned in this class at the end of each class.
Can strengthen theoretical knowledge on Statistics
I wouldnt change anything about this course it was great

This class was great. Andrew Barron is a fantastic lecturer, very clear. He goes in many details, and follows the book quite well. I barely needed to read the book, because the explanations in class were so clear. The first part of the course was great, the second one less so. I felt that during the second part, we saw too many different topics without too much depth, but in the end, the problems were still relevant to learn the material. I feel that we need more time for the second exam, rather than having it on the last day of class. The discussion sessions were also useful to dive deeper in the material.
No handout or slides uploaded to Canvas, which is super inconvenient

One grader (not sure who, since anonymous) wrote detailed feedback on the homework assignments, which was very helpful. This course should modernize by allowing homework to be submitted via Canvas. Using Piazza to allow students to ask questions of the professor and TAs would have been very helpful for understanding concepts that came up in homework that were never taught in class (or explained well in the textbook), and would probably save the TAs significant time since they wouldn't have to answer the same question multiple times from individual students. I feel there must be better textbooks on the market, in terms of presenting material thoroughly and clearly.
I just hope the instructor can post the course notes on canvas.
The homework provides a nice re-cap of what we learn in-class or from the textbook.

Hope there will be more structured lecture slides/materials given before the lecture.
Looking materials more than lecture notes.
It has a very clear setup but sometimes the Professor was not able to follow.
very good class, fun and intuitive. the work load is a bit high though, but practice makes perfect. no complain at all.
thanks
the course covers a lot of materials yet very thorough and detailed.
The class structure was clear and the expectations were fair. Sometimes the lecture and homework content didn't match up exactly so it was hard to complete the problem sets.
Yes I would, if the student is interested in studying statistics, because the course introduces familiar methods in a way that helps you understand what you are interpreting from software outputs.
Yes I think it was really good class to understand statistics better and very well organized.
Yes. Professor Barron makes this course reasonable while still remains some light challenge.
Yes.  Professor Barron is such an inspiring and excellent teacher!
Yes. It helps me to build the solid statistics foundation for other more advanced courses.
Yes
Yes, the content was at the right level and useful and interesting.
Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone interested in introduction to statistics, which can be relevant for many different areas.
Need to update the slides to canvas, better in latex format
Yes. Very helpful for students interested in data science.
Yes, I would. The class gives a nice introduction to theory of statistics.
Yes. This course is essential to crucial to the field of statistics and data science.
I would recommend because it teaches the foundation of statistics.
Yes. this is a really good class for students to understand the basis of statistics.
